summary: Email chain from July 2019 between defense attorney Bruce Barket and Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) staff regarding the condition and treatment of inmate Nicholas Tartaglione, who was a cellmate of Jeffrey Epstein. The emails discuss concerns about Tartaglione's mental state, potential retaliation by staff, and a press inquiry about whether Tartaglione was questioned regarding a possible attack on Epstein.

persons.name: Bruce Barket
persons.context: Attorney representing inmate Nicholas Tartaglione. He is communicating with MCC staff about his client's deteriorating mental condition, arranging visits, and complaining about potential leaks of false information to the press.

persons.name: Nicholas Tartaglione
persons.context: Client of Bruce Barket, incarcerated at MCC. He was a cellmate of Jeffrey Epstein. His parents reported him as 'nearly incoherent' and his attorney is concerned about his mental state and potential retaliation by staff.

persons.name: Tracy Connor
persons.context: Executive editor at The Daily Beast who sent a press inquiry to Bruce Barket, trying to confirm an NBC story about whether Tartaglione was questioned about a possible attack on Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as the subject of a press inquiry regarding a possible attack at MCC, and as the former cellmate of Nicholas Tartaglione.

connections.description: Bruce Barket is the legal representative for inmate Nicholas Tartaglione, advocating for his well-being and handling press inquiries about him.
The document references a press inquiry trying to confirm if Tartaglione was questioned about a possible attack on Epstein, implying they were housed together at MCC.
Connor, a journalist, contacted Barket for comment on a story regarding his client Tartaglione and Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Press Inquiry About Possible Epstein Attack
events.description: Tracy Connor of The Daily Beast emails Bruce Barket trying to confirm an NBC story that his client, Nicholas Tartaglione, was questioned about a possible attack on Jeffrey Epstein at MCC.

events.title: MCC Acknowledges Open Investigation
events.description: An MCC staff member emails Bruce Barket, stating the matter is part of an open investigation and that staff have been cautioned not to retaliate against his client.

events.title: Report on Tartaglione's Deteriorating Condition
events.description: Bruce Barket reports that Tartaglione's parents found him 'nearly incoherent' and 'as bad as he has ever been,' prompting Barket to request a visit and a welfare check.

locations: 666 Old Country Road, Garden City, NY 11530 (Law office of Bruce Barket)
keyFacts: In July 2019, Nicholas Tartaglione, an inmate and former cellmate of Jeffrey Epstein, was reported by his parents to be in a severely deteriorated mental state, described as 'nearly incoherent.'
A press inquiry from The Daily Beast sought to confirm an NBC story that Tartaglione had been questioned about a possible attack on Jeffrey Epstein while both were at MCC.
MCC staff acknowledged an open investigation into the matter and stated they had cautioned staff not to retaliate against Tartaglione.
The email chain shows defense attorney Bruce Barket actively advocating for his client's welfare and addressing potential leaks of false information to the media.
